component.name: Toggle
component.description: Represent a two-state control used for modes or tools.

useCases: Toggling a mode or tool on/off

antiPatterns.reason: System settings have immediate-effect semantics that Switch communicates better
antiPatterns.alternative: Use Switch for on/off system preferences

antiPatterns.scenario: Using Toggle for form field selection
antiPatterns.reason: Toggle is not a form control; it lacks form submission semantics
antiPatterns.alternative: Use Checkbox or RadioGroup for form fields

semanticMeaning.default: Transparent background; minimal chrome for toolbar contexts
semanticMeaning.outline: Bordered with subtle shadow; used for standalone or grouped toggles

slots.toggle: Root pressable element; manages on/off state

interactions.click: Toggles between on and off states
interactions.keyboard: Space/Enter to toggle; Tab to navigate
interactions.hover: Background shifts to muted; text shifts to muted-foreground

accessibility.keyboardSupport: Space/Enter to toggle; Tab to navigate

rules: Toggle behaves like a button with persistent state
Often used in toolbars or compact control groups
Toggle is for tools and modes, not settings

aiHints.context: Toggle is for tools and modes, not settings. Use when a button-like control needs to persist an on/off state (e.g., bold formatting, view mode). For system settings, use Switch. For grouping multiple toggles, use ToggleGroup.
